result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph D. MCCANN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Judgment of Conviction Sentence to Jail.  Duplicate original delivered to Sheriff.

Count 1 - Possess THC (2nd+ & offense) - Guilty plea.  Convicted.  State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, possess drug paraphernalia.  Motion granted.  Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for seven (7) days, under the Huber Law, to commence on 03-03-15 at 8:00 a.m.  
$518.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 03-07-15 or 10 days jail.

records.addlTxt:
Preliminary hearing held.  Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.    Request for Substitution of Judge filed.  
Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 07-01-14 at 3:00 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery. 
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 06-04-14 at 1:45 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess THC as repeater and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-19-14 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond.  Bail is furnished and the defendant is released from custody. 
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
